ygData.msgSnippet: ... Wait a minute:  you surived the super-powered skeletons?  My small army of Summoned Fire Elementals had troubles here. ... The point was to acquire

From: "Daniel Paul Hightower" <dph_of_rules@...>

> I beat 328 and 329 by blowing up all of the tents with exploding 
> arrows, as destroying tents also destroys all the skeletons that it 
> produced. (Same with bone piles, BTW)

Wait a minute:  you surived the super-powered skeletons?  My small 
army of Summoned Fire Elementals had troubles here.
> 
> Level 401 was kind of sad, it was just gold piles and 12 level 1 
> faeries...

The point was to acquire $$$$$$$.
> 
> Level 402... I just moved near the corner, held down enter...

I never actually had the patience to take out the slime.  I waited 
and waited ...
> I agree with the restriction on Archmages, although not entirely on 
> Clerics and Druids, however.
> 
> Archmagi should only be able to have 1 fire elemental, because a 
> level 150+ fire elemental summoned as soon as the battle starts 
makes 
> it a BIT unfair.

Only a BIT unfair?
> 
> Clerics, however, need to actually acquire a kill before they can 
use 
> Ressurection, and Druids' summoning abilities are totally 
worthless. 
> Have you ever USED Druids? Faeries that are summoned are level 1 
NPC 
> faeries - in other words, they suck by the time you can chain-
summon 
> them. Actually, I think that Druids' protection needs restricted. 
You 
> can cast it so much that things totally blur out of existence, and 
> cannot be hit with normal attacks for the next...100 hits. And I 
> think even one Protection is enough to stop a horde of normal Orcs 
> from ever being able to harm you, although I may be wrong on this.

Actually, those summoned faeries need to have experience levels in 
some way tied to the druid's experience level:  like a exp level 50 
Druid could summon exp level 10 faeries.
> 
> In conclusion... Archmages should get 1 fire elemental pet at most, 
> and I'll have to check Clerics' ressurect before I pass judgment on 
> it. (Is it based on ressurected unit level or on Cleric level?) 
> Druids need a cap on Protections, and Orc Captains need to have the 
> Orcs' specials.
> 
> I'm finishing up my set of levels, but I'm not going to disclose 
any 
> details. Yet.

Just remember:  Don't attempt to duplicate my work on creating level 
that yield mega-characters.
